alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 17 at 1:28PM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... .A very cold airmass will settle into the northern plains next week. Low temperatures will fall to the teens and 20s below zero, and high temperatures Tuesday through Thursday will be only in the single digits above and below zero. Wind chills during this period could be in the 20s and 30s below zero; furthermore, breezy winds Wednesday into Thursday could result in wind chills in the 40s and 50s below zero. Conditions will slowly improve Friday into next weekend. ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. Coldest wind chills will be Wednesday night into Thursday morning. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern, southwestern and the Black Hills of South Dakota and northeast and the Black Hills of Wyoming. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A wind chill watch means dangerously low wind chill values are possible due to the combination of very cold air and wind.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills
